intro: Seetzenia, commonly known as the "scented sandmat," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. The leaves are typically narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Seetzenia species are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. These plants are adapted to harsh environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
